solution_line_template: First find how many pairs of slippers Nancy has: {num_boots_pairs} pairs + {slippers_more_than_boots} pairs = <<{num_boots_pairs}+{slippers_more_than_boots}={num_slippers_pairs}>>{num_slippers_pairs} pairs

Then add that number to the number of pairs of boots she has: {num_slippers_pairs} pairs + {num_boots_pairs} pairs = <<{num_slippers_pairs}+{num_boots_pairs}={combined_slippers_boots_pairs}>>{combined_slippers_boots_pairs} pairs

Then triple that number to find how many pairs of heels she has: {combined_slippers_boots_pairs} pairs * {heels_multiplier} = <<{combined_slippers_boots_pairs}*{heels_multiplier}={num_heels_pairs}>>{num_heels_pairs} pairs

Then add the number of pairs of each kind of shoe she has: {num_slippers_pairs} pairs + {num_boots_pairs} pairs + {num_heels_pairs} pairs = <<{num_slippers_pairs}+{num_boots_pairs}+{num_heels_pairs}={total_pairs}>>{total_pairs} pairs

Then multiply the number of pairs by {shoes_per_pair} to find the number of individual shoes she has: {total_pairs} pairs * {shoes_per_pair} shoes/pair = <<{total_pairs}*{shoes_per_pair}={total_individual_shoes}>>{total_individual_shoes} shoes
